name: Egg and Potato Curry
author: sunwind
summary: North Indian in origin, I was very grateful to have found this recipe. It is very similar to what was served to us by our Bengali neighbors years ago! Serve hot with a side of thickly sliced bread.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
1  large potato - cooked, peeled, and cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet over medium heat
Stir in onions; cook and stir until onion pieces are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes
Reduce heat to medium-low; continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until onions are golden, about 10 minutes more
Remove pan from heat and set it aside
Transfer cooked onions to the bowl of a food processor; grind onions, tomatoes, and green chiles into a smooth paste
Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in the same skillet over medium heat
Add onion mixture carefully, as it may spatter
Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes
Stir in garlic paste, ginger paste, coriander, cumin, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and salt
Cook and stir until the oil begins to separate from the mixture, about 5 minutes
Pour water into skillet and bring sauce to a boil
Reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce has thickened slightly, about 10 minutes
